intro: Lepterica tenuis, commonly known as the slender leperica, is a flowering plant native to the temperate regions of South America. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its delicate, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full shade. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and herbal practices.
